page.description: Sends an e-mail message. All e-mail settings are passed in. Does not use an Alpha Five e-mail profile. To see what properties must be set in pSmtpSettings and pMessageSettings when coding, you can run the a5_ShowEmailSettings() function from the Interactive Window.
page.syntax: P Result = email_send_noprofile(P pSmtpSettings ,P pMessageSettings ,C secureMode [,L autoWrap [,L flagUseDotNetLibrary ]])

property.name: smtp_server
property.description: the address of the smtp server. e.g.'smtp.gmail.com'

property.name: smtp_username
property.description: your email account user name, e.g. 'fred' or 'fred@mycompany.com'

property.name: smtp_port
property.description: the port e.g. 465. This depends on the server. For example with Gmail, the port is often 587

argument.name: pMessageSettings
argument.description: An object with these properties (some properties are optional):

property.name: from
property.description: Required. The email address of the sender

property.name: send_to
property.description: Required. A comma delimited list of email addresses

property.name: message
property.description: The plain text version of the message. If html_message is not specified, message is required.

property.name: html_message
property.description: The html version of the message.

property.name: subject
property.description: The message subject, in plain text

property.name: from_alias
property.description: The friendly/display name of the sender

property.name: attachments
property.description: A comma delimited list of file attachments.

property.name: cc
property.description: A comma delimited list of email addresses to "CC".

property.name: bcc
property.description: A comma delimited list of email addresses to "BCC".

property.name: ReturnReceipt
property.description: .t. or .f. indicating whether or not a return receipt is desired.

argument.name: secureMode
argument.description: Mode to use for secure connections. Can be blank, 'SSL', or 'TLS'.

argument.name: autoWrap
argument.description: Word-wrapping mode; does not apply if flagUseDotNetLibrary is .t., and irrelevant for HTML mail; default is .T.

argument.name: flagUseDotNetLibrary
argument.description: By default, the e-mail is sent using Alpha Five's internal 'sockets' object. Since V11 has access to the full Microsoft .NET Framework, you can also send the e-mail using methods in the .NET Framework by setting this value to .T.; default is .F.

return.name: pFlag
return.description: Returns an object with two properties:

property.name: errorText
property.description: Description of the error if any occurred.

page.example:
dim message as p message.from = "jane@acmeinc.com" message.from_alias = "Jane Doe" message.send_to = "user@place.org" message.subject = "Welcome to Acme Inc!" message.message = "The Acme family is excited to see you join."
dim smtpSettings as p smtpSettings.smtp_server = "mail.acmeinc.com" smtpSettings.smtp_username = "username" smtpSettings.password = "password" smtpSettings.port = 25
dim result as p result = email_send_noprofile(smtpSettings,message,"")
? result = error = .F. errorText = ""
